reviews.text: The hotel is rather unprepossessing from the outside. We had been told we could book a secure outside parking space but when we tried to do this I was told we would have to park on the street. The actual car park has an unbelievably low entrance height and we had a top box.
reviews.title: Not Bad Unlike Limoges Itself

reviews.text: The room was adequate and a little dated and, like the rest of the hotel, there wasn't much room to spare. The lift was amazingly small.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: We went for a walk around Limoges and really did not like what we saw. It was like something from behind the Iron Curtain.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a short stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted somewhere nice for dinner but could not find anywhere at all exciting. The helpful receptionist at the hotel recommended a place which turned out to be surprisingly good. Bistrot du Boucher served excellent foie gras and felt like an archetypal French bistro.
reviews.title: Not the best hotel

reviews.text: Le Richelieu was fine with good service but I would never stop in Limoges again.
reviews.title: Is this the best in town?

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights. Helpful staff & no problems with check-in. Were initially told that our car would be parked in a locked garage but instead, it was left parked outside the hotel on the street for all 3 days. The breakfast is small for the price and the hotel bedding is dire - really cheap & scratchy. Limoges is not exactly over-endowed with hotels so there is little or no incentive to improve.
reviews.title: Ok, not great

reviews.text: Just a few minutes stroll from the centre and a variety of restaurants (although there is another almost opposite) we found this hotel quiet and comfortable. Room size was good, bed comfortable and endless hot water. The car parking options are in the garage (€8 per night) or in the secure car park (€5 per night)and I would opt for the secure car park - roller shutter door isolates it, though we were assured the street is safe to park on. Reception staff very very helpful with directions, maps and suggestions for eating out. Limoges is lovely and when we go back (as no doubt we will), we'll stay at the Richelieu.
reviews.title: Quiet & convenient
Was Ok for the price paid
reviews.text: We only paid €63 so didn't expect too much, which was just as well. The room was very small small & the carpet had seen better days. It was clean though. Breakfast was an additional €8.50 which we though was quite dear, so ate in town, which was a good 10 mins walk uphill. The reception staff were very nice. There was a small bar but we never saw anybody using it. If I went back to Limoges I think would stop at the Ibis, its in a much better location.

reviews.title: The most enjoyable stay in France
reviews.text: Since the first contact to ask for a reservation they were different. They answer my request inmediately and very kindly.The hotel is cozy, clean, and friendly. Their breakfast, delicious.And the most important, the service was very, very good. All of them were helpful and warm to us. A very special thanks to Karen Poole!We were to other hotels en France on that trip and before but I have never enjoyed a french hotel as I did at the Richelieu. Hope to go back soon!
